statement:
(Mahler) Let $f$ be a continuous function on the $p$-adic integers
taking values in some finite extension $K$ of $\mathbb{Q}_p$, and for
each $n\in\mathbb{N}$, put
$a_n=\sum_{i=0}^n(-1)^{n-i}\tbinom{n}{i}f(i)$. Then $a_n\rightarrow 0$
as $n\rightarrow\infty$, the series
$\sum_{n=0}^\infty a_n\tbinom{\cdot}{n}$ converges uniformly to $f$ on
$\mathbb{Z}_p$, and
${\Vertf\Vert}_\infty=\sup_{n\geq 0}{\verta_n\vert}_p$, where
${\Vert\cdot\Vert}_\infty$ denotes the sup norm.
names: Mahler's theorem for continuous functions on the $p$-adic integers
